page.title: 11WEST FELTON NOTABLE HOUSES
page.content: THERE ARE SEVERAL LARGE HOUSES IN WEST FELTON,THE MOST OUTSTANDING BEING FELTON GRANGE.OWNED AT THE MOMENT BY MR.& MRS.H.LLOYD IT IS AN IMPOSING GEORGIAN HOUSE WITH LARGE GARDENS A LAWN TENNIS COURT AND STABLING.TWO STONE EAGLES GUARD THE ENTRANCE TO THE DRIVE OF THE HOUSE. THE COURT IS A LARGE BRICK VICTORIAN HOUSE WITH TALL,IMPOSING CHIMNEYS.THE STABLES AND OUTHOUSES ARE USED TO STORE ANTIQUES AT PRESENT.THE BARNS THAT FORMERLY BELONGED TO THE PROPERTY HAVE BEEN TURNED INTO MAISONETTES AND ANOTHER IS AT PRESENT BEING SOLD FOR SIMILAR PURPOSES. BEHIND THE COURT IS A SITE FOR 5 NEW HOUSES,ONE OF WHICH HAS ALREADY BEEN BUILT AND IS CONSIDERED LOCALLY TO BE VERY BADLY DESIGNED AND NOT AT ALL IN KEEPING WITH SURROUNDING HOUSES
